CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 9, 1952, pg. 16, reads: "UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH MID-YEAR COMMENCEMENT - Eighteen Negroes were among the 506 awarded degrees at commencement exercises at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall last Friday afternoon. Dr. Carter Davidson, president of Union COllege, gave the commencement address.  Two Negro educators were granted doctorates.  They were Inabel Burns Lindsay, dean of the School of Social Work at Howard University, and Donald Anderson Edwards, assistant professor of physics at Lincoln University, who completed his work for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy.  Dr. Lindsay and Fletcher L. White who earned a Bachelor of Science degree in education, and missing from the photos...In the second top photo, from the left, is Mary Louise Stone, who became a Master of education.  Her major was in elementary education. - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Louise "Mary Lou" Stone wearing cap and gown, recipient of Master of Education degree, at 1952 University of Pittsburgh mid-year graduation, Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall
